poem:
**Harrison, Between Worlds**

In whisky's amber glow, Ford rides  
where fame's worn whispers softly guide.  
A president, a Hulk, they say,  
yet echoes of the screen may fade.  
  
No cape or mask can hide the thirst  
for spirits bold, a quench uncurbed.  
Marvel may wait, in realms of make,  
while glass and fire tell the tale.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Harrison Ford’s MCU debut can wait. I prefer his whisky ads In the next few weeks, Harrison Ford will officially join the Marvel Cinematic Universe, starring in Captain America: Brave New World as both the president of the United States and Red Hulk. However, the film is shaping up to be a critical and commercial flop – maybe even the biggest Marvel flop yet – and so it makes sense that Ford would want to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
